intro: Cyclospermum leptophyllum var. multisectum, commonly known as the multi-segmented cyclospermum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically hairy foliage. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, linear leaves that are often deeply lobed or toothed. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, spherical fruits known as cypsela. This species is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
